metadata.title: CVE-2023-1872 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux Kernel io_uring system can beexploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The io_file_get_fixedfunction lacks the presence of ctx->uring_lock which can lead to aUse-After-Free vulnerability due a race condition with fixed files gettingunregistered. We recommend upgrading past commitda24142b1ef9fd5d36b76e36bab328a5b27523e8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-71-generic - 5.15.0-71.78
linux-image-5.15.0-71-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-71.78
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-71-generic - 5.15.0-71.78
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-71-generic-64k - 5.15.0-71.78
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
